00043 typedef unsigned long spl_t;
00044 
00045 #define splhigh(x)  rthal_local_irq_save(x)
00046 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00047 #define splexit(x)  rthal_local_irq_restore((x) & 1)
00048 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00049 #define splexit(x)  rthal_local_irq_restore(x)
00050 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00051 #define splnone()   rthal_local_irq_enable()
00052 #define spltest()   rthal_local_irq_test()
00053 #define splget(x)   rthal_local_irq_flags(x)
00054 #define splsync(x)  rthal_local_irq_sync(x)
00055 
00056 typedef struct {
00057 
00058     volatile unsigned long lock;
00059 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG
00060     const char *file;
00061     const char *function;
00062     unsigned line;
00063     int cpu;
00064 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00065 } xnlock_t;
00066 
00067 #ifndef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG
00068 #define XNARCH_LOCK_UNLOCKED (xnlock_t) { 0 }
00069 #else
00070 #define XNARCH_LOCK_UNLOCKED (xnlock_t) {       \
00071         0,                                      \
00072         NULL,                                   \
00073         0,                                      \
00074         -1                                      \
00075         }
00076 #endif /* !CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00077 
00078 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00079 
00080 #ifndef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG
00081 #define xnlock_get_irqsave(lock,x)  ((x) = __xnlock_get_irqsave(lock))
00082 #else /* !CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00083 #define xnlock_get_irqsave(lock,x) \
00084     ((x) = __xnlock_get_irqsave(lock, __FILE__, __LINE__,__FUNCTION__))
00085 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00086 #define xnlock_clear_irqoff(lock)   xnlock_put_irqrestore(lock,1)
00087 #define xnlock_clear_irqon(lock)    xnlock_put_irqrestore(lock,0)
00088 
00089 static inline void xnlock_init (xnlock_t *lock) {
00090 
00091     *lock = XNARCH_LOCK_UNLOCKED;
00092 }
00093 
00094 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG
00095 #define XNARCH_DEBUG_SPIN_LIMIT 3000000
00096 
00097 static inline spl_t
00098 __xnlock_get_irqsave (xnlock_t *lock, const char *file, unsigned line, const char *function)
00099 {
00100     unsigned spin_count = 0;
00101 #else /* !CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00102 static inline spl_t __xnlock_get_irqsave (xnlock_t *lock)
00103 {
00104 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00105     rthal_declare_cpuid;
00106     unsigned long flags;
00107 
00108     rthal_local_irq_save(flags);
00109 
00110     rthal_load_cpuid();
00111 
00112     if (!test_and_set_bit(cpuid,&lock->lock))
00113         {
00114         while (test_and_set_bit(BITS_PER_LONG - 1,&lock->lock))
00115             /* Use an non-locking test in the inner loop, as Linux'es
00116                bit_spin_lock. */
00117             while (test_bit(BITS_PER_LONG - 1,&lock->lock))
00118                 {
00119                 cpu_relax();
00120 
00121 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG
00122                 if (++spin_count == XNARCH_DEBUG_SPIN_LIMIT)
00123                     {
00124                     rthal_emergency_console();
00125                     printk(KERN_ERR
00126                            "RTAI: stuck on nucleus lock %p\n"
00127                            "      waiter = %s:%u (%s(), CPU #%d)\n"
00128                            "      owner  = %s:%u (%s(), CPU #%d)\n",
00129                            lock,file,line,function,cpuid,
00130                            lock->file,lock->line,lock->function,lock->cpu);
00131                     show_stack(NULL,NULL);
00132                     for (;;)
00133                         cpu_relax();
00134                     }
00135 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00136                 }
00137 
00138 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG
00139         lock->file = file;
00140         lock->function = function;
00141         lock->line = line;
00142         lock->cpu = cpuid;
00143 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00144         }
00145     else
00146         flags |= 2;
00147 
00148     return flags;
00149 }
00150 
00151 static inline void xnlock_put_irqrestore (xnlock_t *lock, spl_t flags)
00152 
00153 {
00154     if (!(flags & 2))
00155         {
00156         rthal_declare_cpuid;
00157 
00158         rthal_local_irq_disable();
00159 
00160         rthal_load_cpuid();
00161 
00162         if (test_and_clear_bit(cpuid,&lock->lock))
00163             clear_bit(BITS_PER_LONG - 1,&lock->lock);
00164         }
00165 
00166     rthal_local_irq_restore(flags & 1);
00167 }
00168 
00169 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00170 
00171 #define xnlock_init(lock)              do { } while(0)
00172 #define xnlock_get_irqsave(lock,x)     rthal_local_irq_save(x)
00173 #define xnlock_put_irqrestore(lock,x)  rthal_local_irq_restore(x)
00174 #define xnlock_clear_irqoff(lock)      rthal_local_irq_disable()
00175 #define xnlock_clear_irqon(lock)       rthal_local_irq_enable()
00176 
00177 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */

00187 #define xnarch_printf(fmt,args...)   printk(KERN_INFO XNARCH_PROMPT fmt , ##args)

00192                                         rthal_uldivrem(ull,d,&_rem); _rem; })

00201 typedef cpumask_t xnarch_cpumask_t;
00202 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00203 #define xnarch_cpu_online_map            cpu_online_map
00204 #else
00205 #define xnarch_cpu_online_map            cpumask_of_cpu(0)
00206 #endif
00207 #define xnarch_num_online_cpus()         num_online_cpus()
00208 #define xnarch_cpu_set(cpu, mask)        cpu_set(cpu, mask)
00209 #define xnarch_cpu_clear(cpu, mask)      cpu_clear(cpu, mask)
00210 #define xnarch_cpus_clear(mask)          cpus_clear(mask)
00211 #define xnarch_cpu_isset(cpu, mask)      cpu_isset(cpu, mask)
00212 #define xnarch_cpus_and(dst, src1, src2) cpus_and(dst, src1, src2)
00213 #define xnarch_cpus_equal(mask1, mask2)  cpus_equal(mask1, mask2)
00214 #define xnarch_cpus_empty(mask)          cpus_empty(mask)
00215 #define xnarch_cpumask_of_cpu(cpu)       cpumask_of_cpu(cpu)
00216 #define xnarch_first_cpu(mask)           first_cpu(mask)
00217 #define XNARCH_CPU_MASK_ALL              CPU_MASK_ALL

00219 typedef struct xnarch_heapcb {
00220 
00221     atomic_t numaps;    /* # of active user-space mappings. */
00222 
00223     int kmflags;        /* Kernel memory flags (0 if vmalloc()). */
00224 
00225     void *heapbase;     /* Shared heap memory base. */

00227 } xnarch_heapcb_t;

00233 static inline long long xnarch_tsc_to_ns (long long ts) {
00234     return xnarch_llimd(ts,1000000000,RTHAL_CPU_FREQ);
00235 }
00236 
00237 static inline long long xnarch_ns_to_tsc (long long ns) {
00238     return xnarch_llimd(ns,RTHAL_CPU_FREQ,1000000000);
00239 }
00240 
00241 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_get_cpu_time (void) {
00242     return xnarch_tsc_to_ns(xnarch_get_cpu_tsc());
00243 }
00244 
00245 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_get_cpu_freq (void) {
00246     return RTHAL_CPU_FREQ;
00247 }

00249 static inline unsigned xnarch_current_cpu (void) {
00250     return rthal_processor_id();
00251 }

00257 #define xnarch_halt(emsg) \
00258 do { \
00259     rthal_emergency_console(); \
00260     xnarch_logerr("fatal: %s\n",emsg); \
00261     show_stack(NULL,NULL);                      \
00262     for (;;) cpu_relax();                       \
00263 } while(0)

00265 static inline int xnarch_setimask (int imask)
00266 
00267 {
00268     spl_t s;
00269     splhigh(s);
00270     splexit(!!imask);
00271     return !!s;
00272 }

00278 static inline int xnarch_send_ipi (xnarch_cpumask_t cpumask) {
00279 
00280     return rthal_send_ipi(ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0, cpumask);
00281 }
00282 
00283 static inline int xnarch_hook_ipi (void (*handler)(void))
00284 
00285 {
00286     return rthal_virtualize_irq(&rthal_domain,
00287                                 ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0,
00288                                 (void (*)(unsigned)) handler,
00289                                 NULL,
00290                                 IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00291 }
00292 
00293 static inline int xnarch_release_ipi (void)
00294 
00295 {
00296     return rthal_virtualize_irq(&rthal_domain,
00297                                 ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0,
00298                                 NULL,
00299                                 NULL,
00300                                 IPIPE_PASS_MASK);
00301 }
00302 
00303 static struct linux_semaphore xnarch_finalize_sync;
00304 
00305 static void xnarch_finalize_cpu(unsigned irq)
00306 {
00307     up(&xnarch_finalize_sync);
00308 }
00309 
00310 static inline void xnarch_notify_halt(void)
00311     
00312 {
00313     xnarch_cpumask_t other_cpus = cpu_online_map;
00314     unsigned cpu, nr_cpus = num_online_cpus();
00315     unsigned long flags;
00316     rthal_declare_cpuid;
00317 
00318     sema_init(&xnarch_finalize_sync,0);
00319 
00320     /* Here rthal_current_domain is in fact root, since xnarch_notify_halt is
00321        called from xnpod_shutdown, itself called from Linux
00322        context. */
00323 
00324     rthal_virtualize_irq(rthal_current_domain,
00325                          ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI2,
00326                          xnarch_finalize_cpu,
00327                          NULL,
00328                          IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00329 
00330     rthal_lock_cpu(flags);
00331     cpu_clear(cpuid, other_cpus);
00332     rthal_send_ipi(ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI2, other_cpus);
00333     rthal_unlock_cpu(flags);
00334 
00335     for(cpu=0; cpu < nr_cpus-1; ++cpu)
00336         down(&xnarch_finalize_sync);
00337     
00338     rthal_virtualize_irq(rthal_current_domain,
00339                          ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI2,
00340                          NULL,
00341                          NULL,
00342                          IPIPE_PASS_MASK);
00343 }
00344 
00345 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00346 
00347 static inline int xnarch_send_ipi (xnarch_cpumask_t cpumask) {
00348 
00349     return 0;
00350 }

00352 static inline int xnarch_hook_ipi (void (*handler)(void)) {
00353 
00354     return 0;

00357 static inline int xnarch_release_ipi (void) {
00358 
00359     return 0;
00360 }

00362 #define xnarch_notify_halt() /* Nullified */
00363 
00364 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00365 
00366 static inline void xnarch_notify_shutdown(void)
00367 
00368 {
00369 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00370     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
00371        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
00372     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
00373 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00374 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00375     xnshadow_release_events();
00376 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00377     /* Wait for the currently processed events to drain. */
00378     set_current_state(TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
00379     schedule_timeout(50);
00380     xnarch_release_ipi();
00381 }
00382 
00383 static inline int xnarch_escalate (void)
00384 
00385 {
00386     extern int xnarch_escalation_virq;
00387 
00388     if (rthal_current_domain == rthal_root_domain)
00389         {
00390         spl_t s;
00391         splsync(s);
00392         rthal_trigger_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00393         splexit(s);
00394         return 1;
00395         }
00396 
00397     return 0;
00398 }
00399 
00400 static void xnarch_notify_ready (void)
00401 
00402 {
00403 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION    
00404     xnshadow_grab_events();
00405 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00406 }

00408 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_get_sys_time(void)
00409 {
00410     struct timeval tv;
00411     do_gettimeofday(&tv);
00412     return tv.tv_sec * 1000000000ULL + tv.tv_usec * 1000;
00413 }

00464 static inline void xnarch_init_heapcb (xnarch_heapcb_t *hcb)
00465 
00466 {
00467     atomic_set(&hcb->numaps,0);
00468     hcb->kmflags = 0;
00469     hcb->heapbase = NULL;
00470 }
00471 
00472 static inline int xnarch_remap_page_range(struct vm_area_struct *vma,
00473                                           unsigned long uvaddr,
00474                                           unsigned long paddr,
00475                                           unsigned long size,
00476                                           pgprot_t prot)
00477 {
00478 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= KERNEL_VERSION(2,6,10)
00479     return remap_pfn_range(vma,uvaddr,paddr >> PAGE_SHIFT,size,prot);
00480 #else /* Linux version < 2.6.10 */
00481     return remap_page_range(vma,uvaddr,paddr,size,prot);
00482 #endif /* Linux version >= 2.6.10 */
00483 }
00484 
00485 #endif /* XENO_HEAP_MODULE */
